017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ipt;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
024import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
025import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
026import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
027import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
028
029import java.nio.Buffer;
030
031/**
032 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
033 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the intensity and chromatic channels of a color by multiplication
034 * (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from
035 * {@link Palette} or generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the IPT color space where SpriteBatch
036 * normally uses RGBA, which means that in the batch color, r maps to additive intensity, g maps to additive protan, b
037 * maps to additive tritan, and a maps to multiplicative alpha. Additive values cause no change when they are 0.5, but
038 * cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at 0.0. In the tweak, r maps to multiplicative intensity, g maps
039 * to multiplicative protan, b maps to multiplicative tritan, and a maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with the
040 * additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative values, but you can think of the existing color as being
041 * temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the IPT channels, so each IPT channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being
042 * multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values less than 0.5 make
043 * colors closer to grayscale and values greater than 0.5 make colors more vibrant) and then shifted back to its prior
044 * range. Contrast is a special value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make intensity changes less
045 * distinct between similar colors, while higher values will "sharpen" the changes in intensity.
046 * <br>
047 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 12/14/2019.
048 */
049public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
050    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
051    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
052
053    private Mesh mesh;
054
055    private final float[] vertices;
056    private int idx = 0;
057    private Texture lastTexture = null;
058    private float invTexWidth = 0, invTexHeight = 0;
059
060    private boolean drawing = false;
061
062    private final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
063    private final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
064    private final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
065
066    private boolean blendingDisabled = false;
067    private int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
068    private int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
069    private int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
070    private int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
071
072    private final ShaderProgram shader;
073    private ShaderProgram customShader = null;
074    private boolean ownsShader;
075
076    protected float color = Palette.GRAY;
077    private final Color tempColor = new Color(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 1f);
078
079    /**
080     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
081     * all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
082     * intensity multiplier or intensity contrast, and it won't change either chromatic value multiplier.
083     */
084    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.ipt(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
085    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
086
087    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
088    public int renderCalls = 0;
089
090    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
091    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
092
093    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
094    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
095
096    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
097     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
098    public ColorfulBatch() {
099        this(1000, null);
100    }
101
102    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
103     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
104    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
105        this(size, null);
106    }
107
108    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
109     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
110     * respect to the current screen resolution.
111     * <p>
112     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
113     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
114     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 16383.
115     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
116    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
117        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 4 vertices per sprite = 16383 sprites max.
118        if (size > 16383) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 16383 sprites per batch: " + size);
119
120        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
121
122        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
123                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
124                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
125                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
126                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
127
128        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
129
130        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
131
132        int len = size * 6;
133        short[] indices = new short[len];
134        short j = 0;
135        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
136            indices[i] = j;
137            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
138            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
139            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
140            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
141            indices[i + 5] = j;
142        }
143        mesh.setIndices(indices);
144
145        if (defaultShader == null) {
146            shader = createDefaultShader();
147            ownsShader = true;
148        } else
149            shader = defaultShader;
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Makes a new instance of the default ShaderProgram used for this ColorfulBatch, without any {@code #version}
154     * specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
155     * for the tweak. You may want to set the code to prepend before you call this, as with:
156     * {@code ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "#version 110\n";
157     * ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "#version 110\n";}
158     * The actual version can be different, and may need to be different for compatibility with some hardware.
159     * @return a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified
160     */
161    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
162        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
163                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
164                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
165                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
166                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
167                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
168                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
169                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
170                + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
171                + "\n"
172                + "void main()\n"
173                + "{\n"
174                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
175                + "   v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
176                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
177                + "   v_tweak.a = pow(v_tweak.a * (255.0/254.0) + 0.5, 1.709);\n"
178                + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.a, 1.41421356);\n"
179                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
180                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
181                + "}\n";
182        String fragmentShader =
183                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
184                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
185                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
186                        "#else\n" +
187                        "#define LOWP \n" +
188                        "#endif\n" +
189                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
190                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
191                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
192                        "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
193                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
194                        "void main()\n" +
195                        "{\n" +
196                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
197                        "  vec3 ipt = mat3(0.189786, 0.669665 , 0.286498, 0.576951, -0.73741 , 0.655205, 0.233221, 0.0681367, -0.941748)\n" +
198                        "             * tgt.rgb;\n" +
199                        "  ipt.x = pow(ipt.x, v_tweak.a) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.r + v_color.r - 0.5;\n" +
200                        "  ipt.yz = (ipt.yz * v_tweak.gb + v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
201                        "  vec3 back = mat3(0.999779, 1.00015, 0.999769, 1.07094, -0.377744, 0.0629496, 0.324891, 0.220439, -0.809638) * ipt;\n" +
202                        "  gl_FragColor = clamp(vec4(back, v_color.a * tgt.a), 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
203                        "}";
204
205
206        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
207        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
208        return shader;
209    }
210
211    @Override
212    public void begin () {
213        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
214        renderCalls = 0;
215
216        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
217        if (customShader != null)
218            customShader.bind();
219        else
220            shader.bind();
221        setupMatrices();
222
223        drawing = true;
224    }
225
226    @Override
227    public void end () {
228        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
229        if (idx > 0) flush();
230        lastTexture = null;
231        drawing = false;
232
233        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
234        gl.glDepthMask(true);
235        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
236    }
237
238    @Override
239    public void setColor (Color tint) {
240        color = tint.toFloatBits();
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
245     * For the IPT parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
246     * value. For IPT, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
247     * @see ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float) 
248     * @param intensity like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
249     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
250     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
251     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
252     */
253    @Override
254    public void setColor (float intensity, float protan, float tritan, float alpha) {
255        color = ColorTools.ipt(intensity, protan, tritan, alpha);
256    }
257
258    public void setColor (final float color) {
259        setPackedColor(color);
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Expects an int color in the format (intensity, 8 bits), (protan, 8 bits), (tritan, 8 bits), (alpha, 7 bits),
264     * (ignored, 1 bit).
265     * @param color an int color with alpha in the least significant byte and intensity in the most significant
266     */
267    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
268        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
269    }
270
271    /**
272     * Sets the color with the given IPT and A parameters from 0 to 255.
273     * For the IPT parameters, 127 or 128 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
274     * value. For IPT, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
275     * @see ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float) 
276     * @param intensity like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
277     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 255 (orange/red/purple)
278     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 255 (green/yellow/orange)
279     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded); multiplicative
280     */
281    public void setIntColor(int intensity, int protan, int tritan, int alpha) {
282        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
283                | (tritan << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (protan << 8 & 0xFF00) | (intensity & 0xFF));
284    }
285
286    @Override
287    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
288        this.color = color;
289    }
290
291    @Override
292    public Color getColor () {
293        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
294        Color color = tempColor;
295        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
296        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
297        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
298        color.a = (intBits >>> 25) / 127f;
299        return color;
300    }
301
302    @Override
303    public float getPackedColor () {
304        return color;
305    }
306
307    /**
308     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
309     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak.
310     * @param intensity like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
311     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 1 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
312     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 1 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
313     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
314     */
315    public void setTweak (float intensity, float protan, float tritan, float contrast) {
316        tweak = ColorTools.ipt(intensity, protan, tritan, contrast);
317    }
318
319    /**
320     * Sets the tweak using a single packed IPT float.
321     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
322     * @param tweak a packed IPT float, with contrast instead of alpha
323     */
324    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
325        this.tweak = tweak;
326    }
327    
328    public float getTweak () {
329        return tweak;
330    }
331
332    /**
333     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: intensity (8 bits), protan (8 bits), tritan (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
334     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0x7820206E, which slightly darkens (with intensity 0x78, slightly
335     * below the halfway point of 0x80), significantly reduces colorfulness with protan and tritan multipliers of 0x20
336     * (closer to 0, so most colors will be almost grayscale), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the
337     * ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
338     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with intensity in the most significant bits and contrast in least
339     */
340    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
341        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
342    }
343
344    /**
345     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have
346     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (127, 127, 127, 127)} will effectively remove the tweak.
347     * @param intensity like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
348     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 255 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
349     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 255 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
350     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
351     */
352    public void setIntTweak(int intensity, int protan, int tritan, int contrast) {
353        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
354                | (tritan << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (protan << 8 & 0xFF00) | (intensity & 0xFF));
355    }
356
357    /**
358     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
359     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time.
360     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
361     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
362     */
363    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
364        setColor(color);
365        setTweak(tweak);
366    }
367
368    /**
369     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
370     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
371     * @param intensityAdd like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
372     * @param protanAdd cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
373     * @param tritanAdd artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
374     * @param alphaMul opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
375     * @param intensityMul like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
376     * @param protanMul cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
377     * @param tritanMul artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
378     * @param contrast foggy-to-sharp lightness contrast; affects most other components; ranges from 0 (flat, foggy lightness) to 1 (sharp, crisp lightness)
379     */
380    public void setTweakedColor(final float intensityAdd, final float protanAdd,
381                                final float tritanAdd, final float alphaMul,
382                                final float intensityMul, final float protanMul,
383                                final float tritanMul, final float contrast) {
384        setColor(intensityAdd, protanAdd, tritanAdd, alphaMul);
385        setTweak(intensityMul, protanMul, tritanMul, contrast);
386    }
387
388    @Override
389    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
390                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
391        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
392
393        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
394
395        if (texture != lastTexture)
396            switchTexture(texture);
397        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
398            flush();
399
400        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
401        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
402        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
403        float fx = -originX;
404        float fy = -originY;
405        float fx2 = width - originX;
406        float fy2 = height - originY;
407
408        // scale
409        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
410            fx *= scaleX;
411            fy *= scaleY;
412            fx2 *= scaleX;
413            fy2 *= scaleY;
414        }
415
416        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
417        final float p1x = fx;
418        final float p1y = fy;
419        final float p2x = fx;
420        final float p2y = fy2;
421        final float p3x = fx2;
422        final float p3y = fy2;
423        final float p4x = fx2;
424        final float p4y = fy;
425
426        float x1;
427        float y1;
428        float x2;
429        float y2;
430        float x3;
431        float y3;
432        float x4;
433        float y4;
434
435        // rotate
436        if (rotation != 0) {
437            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
438            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
439
440            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
441            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
442
443            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
444            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
445
446            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
447            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
448
449            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
450            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
451        } else {
452            x1 = p1x;
453            y1 = p1y;
454
455            x2 = p2x;
456            y2 = p2y;
457
458            x3 = p3x;
459            y3 = p3y;
460
461            x4 = p4x;
462            y4 = p4y;
463        }
464
465        x1 += worldOriginX;
466        y1 += worldOriginY;
467        x2 += worldOriginX;
468        y2 += worldOriginY;
469        x3 += worldOriginX;
470        y3 += worldOriginY;
471        x4 += worldOriginX;
472        y4 += worldOriginY;
473
474        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
475        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
476        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
477        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
478
479        if (flipX) {
480            float tmp = u;
481            u = u2;
482            u2 = tmp;
483        }
484
485        if (flipY) {
486            float tmp = v;
487            v = v2;
488            v2 = tmp;
489        }
490
491        final float color = this.color;
492        final float tweak = this.tweak;
493        final int idx = this.idx;
494        vertices[idx] = x1;
495        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
496        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
497        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
498        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
499        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
500
501        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
502        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
503        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
504        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
505        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
506        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
507
508        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
509        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
510        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
511        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
512        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
513        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
514
515        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
516        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
517        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
518        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
519        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
520        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
521        this.idx = idx + 24;
522    }
523
524    @Override
525    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
526                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
527        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
528
529        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
530
531        if (texture != lastTexture)
532            switchTexture(texture);
533        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
534            flush();
535
536        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
537        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
538        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
539        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
540        final float fx2 = x + width;
541        final float fy2 = y + height;
542
543        if (flipX) {
544            float tmp = u;
545            u = u2;
546            u2 = tmp;
547        }
548
549        if (flipY) {
550            float tmp = v;
551            v = v2;
552            v2 = tmp;
553        }
554
555        final float color = this.color;
556        final float tweak = this.tweak;
557        final int idx = this.idx;
558        vertices[idx] = x;
559        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
560        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
561        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
562        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
563        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
564
565        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
566        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
567        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
568        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
569        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
570        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
571
572        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
573        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
574        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
575        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
576        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
577        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
578
579        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
580        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
581        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
582        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
583        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
584        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
585        this.idx = idx + 24;
586    }
587
588    @Override
589    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
590        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
591
592        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
593
594        if (texture != lastTexture)
595            switchTexture(texture);
596        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
597            flush();
598
599        final float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
600        final float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
601        final float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
602        final float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
603        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
604        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
605
606        final float color = this.color;
607        final float tweak = this.tweak;
608        final int idx = this.idx;
609        vertices[idx] = x;
610        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
611        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
612        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
613        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
614        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
615
616        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
617        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
618        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
619        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
620        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
621        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
622
623        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
624        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
625        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
626        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
627        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
628        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
629
630        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
631        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
632        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
633        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
634        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
635        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
636        this.idx = idx + 24;
637    }

644

646            switchTexture(texture);
647        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
648            flush();

651        final float fy2 = y + height;
652
653        final float color = this.color;
654        final float tweak = this.tweak;
655        final int idx = this.idx;
656        vertices[idx] = x;
657        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
658        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
659        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
660        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
661        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;

686    @Override

690
691    @Override
692    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
693        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
694
695        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
696
697        if (texture != lastTexture)
698            switchTexture(texture);
699        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
700            flush();
701
702        final float fx2 = x + width;
703        final float fy2 = y + height;
704        final float u = 0;
705        final float v = 1;
706        final float u2 = 1;
707        final float v2 = 0;
708
709        final float color = this.color;
710        final float tweak = this.tweak;
711        final int idx = this.idx;
712        vertices[idx] = x;
713        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
714        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
715        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
716        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
717        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
718
719        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
720        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
721        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
722        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
723        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
724        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
725
726        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
727        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
728        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
729        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
730        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
731        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
732
733        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
734        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
735        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
736        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
737        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
738        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
739        this.idx = idx + 24;
740    }
741
742    /**
743     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
744     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
745     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
746     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
747     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
748     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
749     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
750     */
751    @Override
752    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
753        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
754
755        count = (count / 5) * 6;
756        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
757        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
758        if (texture != lastTexture)
759            switchTexture(texture);
760        else {
761            remainingVertices -= idx;
762            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
763                flush();
764                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
765            }
766        }
767        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
768        final float tweak = this.tweak;
769
770        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
771        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
772        ////new way, thanks mgsx
773        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
774            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
775            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
776            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
777            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
778            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
779            vertices[v++] = tweak;
780        }
781        idx += copyCount;
782        count -= copyCount;
783        while (count > 0) {
784            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
785            flush();
786            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
787            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
788            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
789            ////new way, thanks mgsx
790            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
791                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
792                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
793                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
794                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
795                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
796                vertices[v++] = tweak;
797            }
798            idx += copyCount;
799            count -= copyCount;
800        }
801    }
802
803    /**
804     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
805     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
806     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
807     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
808     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
809     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
810     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
811     */
812    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
813        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
814
815        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
816        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
817        if (texture != lastTexture)
818            switchTexture(texture);
819        else {
820            remainingVertices -= idx;
821            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
822                flush();
823                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
824            }
825        }
826        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
827
828        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
829        idx += copyCount;
830        count -= copyCount;
831        while (count > 0) {
832            offset += copyCount;
833            flush();
834            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
835            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
836            idx += copyCount;
837            count -= copyCount;
838        }
839    }
840
841    @Override
842    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
843        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
844    }
845
846    @Override
847    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
848        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
849
850        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
851
852        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
853        if (texture != lastTexture) {
854            switchTexture(texture);
855        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
856            flush();
857        }
858        final float fx2 = x + width;
859        final float fy2 = y + height;
860        final float u = region.getU();
861        final float v = region.getV2();
862        final float u2 = region.getU2();
863        final float v2 = region.getV();
864
865        final float color = this.color;
866        final float tweak = this.tweak;
867        final int idx = this.idx;
868        vertices[idx] = x;
869        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
870        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
871        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
872        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
873        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
874
875        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
876        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
877        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
878        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
879        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
880        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
881
882        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
883        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
884        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
885        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
886        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
887        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
888
889        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
890        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
891        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
892        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
893        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
894        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
895        this.idx = idx + 24;
896    }
897
898    @Override
899    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
900                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
901        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
902
903        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
904
905        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
906        if (texture != lastTexture) {
907            switchTexture(texture);
908        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
909            flush();
910
911        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
912        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
913        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
914        float fx = -originX;
915        float fy = -originY;
916        float fx2 = width - originX;
917        float fy2 = height - originY;
918
919        // scale
920        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
921            fx *= scaleX;
922            fy *= scaleY;
923            fx2 *= scaleX;
924            fy2 *= scaleY;
925        }
926
927        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
928        final float p1x = fx;
929        final float p1y = fy;
930        final float p2x = fx;
931        final float p2y = fy2;
932        final float p3x = fx2;
933        final float p3y = fy2;
934        final float p4x = fx2;
935        final float p4y = fy;
936
937        float x1;
938        float y1;
939        float x2;
940        float y2;
941        float x3;
942        float y3;
943        float x4;
944        float y4;
945
946        // rotate
947        if (rotation != 0) {
948            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
949            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
950
951            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
952            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
953
954            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
955            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
956
957            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
958            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
959
960            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
961            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
962        } else {
963            x1 = p1x;
964            y1 = p1y;
965
966            x2 = p2x;
967            y2 = p2y;
968
969            x3 = p3x;
970            y3 = p3y;
971
972            x4 = p4x;
973            y4 = p4y;
974        }
975
976        x1 += worldOriginX;
977        y1 += worldOriginY;
978        x2 += worldOriginX;
979        y2 += worldOriginY;
980        x3 += worldOriginX;
981        y3 += worldOriginY;
982        x4 += worldOriginX;
983        y4 += worldOriginY;
984
985        final float u = region.getU();
986        final float v = region.getV2();
987        final float u2 = region.getU2();
988        final float v2 = region.getV();
989
990        final float color = this.color;
991        final float tweak = this.tweak;
992        final int idx = this.idx;
993        vertices[idx] = x1;
994        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
995        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
996        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
997        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
998        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
999
1000        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1001        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1002        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1003        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1004        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1005        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1006
1007        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1008        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1009        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1010        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1011        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1012        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1013
1014        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1015        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1016        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1017        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1018        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1019        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1020        this.idx = idx + 24;
1021    }
1022
1023    @Override
1024    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1025                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1026        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1027
1028        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1029
1030        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1031        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1032            switchTexture(texture);
1033        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1034            flush();
1035
1036        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1037        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1038        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1039        float fx = -originX;
1040        float fy = -originY;
1041        float fx2 = width - originX;
1042        float fy2 = height - originY;
1043
1044        // scale
1045        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1046            fx *= scaleX;
1047            fy *= scaleY;
1048            fx2 *= scaleX;
1049            fy2 *= scaleY;
1050        }
1051
1052        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1053        final float p1x = fx;
1054        final float p1y = fy;
1055        final float p2x = fx;
1056        final float p2y = fy2;
1057        final float p3x = fx2;
1058        final float p3y = fy2;
1059        final float p4x = fx2;
1060        final float p4y = fy;
1061
1062        float x1;
1063        float y1;
1064        float x2;
1065        float y2;
1066        float x3;
1067        float y3;
1068        float x4;
1069        float y4;
1070
1071        // rotate
1072        if (rotation != 0) {
1073            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1074            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1075
1076            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1077            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1078
1079            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1080            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1081
1082            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1083            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1084
1085            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1086            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1087        } else {
1088            x1 = p1x;
1089            y1 = p1y;
1090
1091            x2 = p2x;
1092            y2 = p2y;
1093
1094            x3 = p3x;
1095            y3 = p3y;
1096
1097            x4 = p4x;
1098            y4 = p4y;
1099        }
1100
1101        x1 += worldOriginX;
1102        y1 += worldOriginY;
1103        x2 += worldOriginX;
1104        y2 += worldOriginY;
1105        x3 += worldOriginX;
1106        y3 += worldOriginY;
1107        x4 += worldOriginX;
1108        y4 += worldOriginY;
1109
1110        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1111        if (clockwise) {
1112            u1 = region.getU2();
1113            v1 = region.getV2();
1114            u2 = region.getU();
1115            v2 = region.getV2();
1116            u3 = region.getU();
1117            v3 = region.getV();
1118            u4 = region.getU2();
1119            v4 = region.getV();
1120        } else {
1121            u1 = region.getU();
1122            v1 = region.getV();
1123            u2 = region.getU2();
1124            v2 = region.getV();
1125            u3 = region.getU2();
1126            v3 = region.getV2();
1127            u4 = region.getU();
1128            v4 = region.getV2();
1129        }
1130
1131        final float color = this.color;
1132        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1133        final int idx = this.idx;
1134        vertices[idx] = x1;
1135        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1136        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1137        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1138        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1139        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1140
1141        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1142        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1143        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1144        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1145        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1146        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1147
1148        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1149        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1150        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1151        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1152        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1153        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1154
1155        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1156        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1157        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1158        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1159        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1160        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1161        this.idx = idx + 24;
1162    }
1163
1164    @Override
1165    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1166        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1167
1168        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1169
1170        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1171        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1172            switchTexture(texture);
1173        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1174            flush();
1175        }
1176
1177        // construct corner points
1178        float x1 = transform.m02;
1179        float y1 = transform.m12;
1180        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1181        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1182        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1183        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1184        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1185        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1186
1187        float u = region.getU();
1188        float v = region.getV2();
1189        float u2 = region.getV2();
1190        float v2 = region.getV();
1191
1192        final float color = this.color;
1193        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1194        final int idx = this.idx;
1195        vertices[idx] = x1;
1196        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1197        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1198        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1199        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1200        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1201
1202        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1203        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1204        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1205        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1206        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1207        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1208
1209        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1210        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1211        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1212        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1213        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1214        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1215
1216        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1217        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1218        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1219        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1220        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1221        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1222        this.idx = idx + 24;
1223    }
1224
1225    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1226    @Override
1227    public void flush () {
1228        if (idx == 0) return;
1229
1230        renderCalls++;
1231        totalRenderCalls++;
1232        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1233        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1234        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1235
1236        lastTexture.bind();
1237        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1238        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1239        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).position(0);
1240        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).limit(count);
1241
1242        if (blendingDisabled) {
1243            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1244        } else {
1245            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1246            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1247        }
1248
1249        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1250
1251        idx = 0;
1252    }
1253
1254    @Override
1255    public void disableBlending () {
1256        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1257        flush();
1258        blendingDisabled = true;
1259    }
1260
1261    @Override
1262    public void enableBlending () {
1263        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1264        flush();
1265        blendingDisabled = false;
1266    }
1267
1268    @Override
1269    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1270        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1271    }
1272
1273    @Override
1274    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1275        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1276        flush();
1277        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1278        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1279        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1280        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1281    }
1282
1283    @Override
1284    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1285        return blendSrcFunc;
1286    }
1287
1288    @Override
1289    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1290        return blendDstFunc;
1291    }
1292
1293    @Override
1294    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1295        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1296    }
1297
1298    @Override
1299    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1300        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1301    }
1302
1303    @Override
1304    public void dispose () {
1305        mesh.dispose();
1306        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1307    }
1308
1309    @Override
1310    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1311        return projectionMatrix;
1312    }
1313
1314    @Override
1315    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1316        return transformMatrix;
1317    }
1318
1319    @Override
1320    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1321        if (drawing) flush();
1322        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1323        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1324    }
1325
1326    @Override
1327    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1328        if (drawing) flush();
1329        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1330        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1331    }
1332
1333    protected void setupMatrices () {
1334        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1335        if (customShader != null) {
1336            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1337            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1338        } else {
1339            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1340            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1341        }
1342    }
1343
1344    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1345        flush();
1346        lastTexture = texture;
1347        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1348        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1349    }
1350
1351    @Override
1352    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1353        if (drawing) {
1354            flush();
1355        }
1356        customShader = shader;
1357        if (drawing) {
1358            if (customShader != null)
1359                customShader.bind();
1360            else
1361                this.shader.bind();
1362            setupMatrices();
1363        }
1364    }
1365
1366    @Override
1367    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1368        if (customShader == null) {
1369            return shader;
1370        }
1371        return customShader;
1372    }
1373
1374    @Override
1375    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1376        return !blendingDisabled;
1377    }
1378
1379    public boolean isDrawing () {
1380        return drawing;
1381    }
1382    public static final int X1 = 0;
1383    public static final int Y1 = 1;
1384    public static final int C1 = 2;
1385    public static final int U1 = 3;
1386    public static final int V1 = 4;
1387    public static final int T1 = 5;
1388    public static final int X2 = 6;
1389    public static final int Y2 = 7;
1390    public static final int C2 = 8;
1391    public static final int U2 = 9;
1392    public static final int V2 = 10;
1393    public static final int T2 = 11;
1394    public static final int X3 = 12;
1395    public static final int Y3 = 13;
1396    public static final int C3 = 14;
1397    public static final int U3 = 15;
1398    public static final int V3 = 16;
1399    public static final int T3 = 17;
1400    public static final int X4 = 18;
1401    public static final int Y4 = 19;
1402    public static final int C4 = 20;
1403    public static final int U4 = 21;
1404    public static final int V4 = 22;
1405    public static final int T4 = 23;
1406}
